alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 17 at 8:09PM AKDT until March 19 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM AKDT SATURDAY THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches possible. Heaviest snow accumulations along the Seward Highway from Moose Pass through Turnagain Pass. Blowing snow with visibilities reduced to one half mile or less at times, especially through Portage Valley. * WHERE...Western Prince William Sound. * WHEN...From Saturday morning through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A storm system very much like the one that passed on Friday will impact the area bringing another round of snow and wind. As the front passes Sunday afternoon and evening, and winds shift from north to south, strong winds will reduced visibity along the Seward Highway.
info.instruction: A winter storm means there is a potential for significant snow, sleet, or ice accumulations that may impact travel. People are encouraged to closely monitor this weather situation. Preparation for this potentially dangerous weather event should begin now. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
